intro: Ophrys dyris var. maculata, commonly known as the spotted bee orchid, is a rare and specialized orchid species native to parts of Europe. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, which mimics the appearance of a female bee to attract male bees for pollination. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodland floors and meadows. Its flowers are usually a mix of brown and yellow, with distinctive spots that enhance its mimicry. The species is of interest to botanists due to its intricate pollination mechanism and limited distribution.
